Reviews.Title: “Charismatic Club/Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 12Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: Soho House is what I was looking for in Berlin ! It is not a typical 5 star hotel, but more a private club with individual, yet cool and classy rooms. Great service by a different kind of staff, very attentive and personal. The hotel is in the Eastern part, close to Alexanderplatz and offers an experience which other Berlin Hotels as Ritz Carlton lack. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TrufflesSmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Soho House Berlin and would happily have stayed longer - it is a stylish yet comfortable hotel with lots of character. We were impressed with our 'small' yet quite spacious room and delighted with the selection of Cowshed products available, the tea & coffee tray, the decent hairdryer, the chocolate egg on Easter Sunday...I could go on! We found the service excellent - from reception, to the spa to the bar/restaurant areas - we could not fault it. Everyone was friendly and relaxed, always happy to help. The place definitely has a particular vibe or atmosphere which is just right for a chilled weekend away. We didn't get round to trying out the gym but enjoyed the spa/hammam - it was a good place to unwind and warm up on a cold, wet Berlin day! The table tennis in reception was also good fun and a nice touch. The bar/lounge area is also very comfortable with a great atmosphere - we loved the roaring fires, the live pianist, the cocktails and food (which we found to be refreshingly reasonably priced), playing a game of scrabble after dinner...again, I could go on. All in all, we had a great time at Soho House and would definitely stay again if we're in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: adventure551
Reviews.Content: Still the best place I have ever stayed. Rooms have character and are comfortable - amazing beds, great selection of toiletries (everything down to toothbrush provided) and home baked bsicuits in the room. The bar (rose petal martini is a must try) is a great place to keep an eye open for celebrities and the location is within walking distance of all the city sights. I wouldn't stat anywhere else when I'm in Berlin. I'm even scheduling a stopover from the UK to Singapore just to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: IcebarOslo
Reviews.Content: Im a huge fan of the Soho House brand and I absolutely love the Soho House Berlin. I stay here every time I come to Berlin The reception staff is amazing and very helpful, always giving you tips about the city. The restaurant & bar, both main and rooftop, is the perfect place to start either your day or night. Really great prices too Rooftop terrace is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, nice & special place, but staff is a bit 'too cool for school'...”
Reviews.Author: MayfairLady1
Reviews.Content: We've been to Soho House Berlin twice and would always come back, as we really like the style, the huge rooms and beds, the cool rooftop terrace with it's pool and the bar, and just the overall vibe - and the location of course. However, the service definitely has to improve. Reception is good and helpful, but the waiters at the rooftop-bar and restaurant are seriously terrible. All seem to be more worried about their looks than about their guests. We had several occasions where we had to wait for a very long time without even being noticed, and then eventually had to ask for the menus ourselves. Same happens if you want to order sth, or add anything to your order at a later stage, etc... And we did not only experience this ourselves, but also witnessed multiple similar situations with other guests desperately seeking the staffs attention... If this would improve and both the waiters and bar/restaurant manager be a bit more attentive, friendly and apologetic, this would be the perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if it's to your taste”
Reviews.Author: JeffBarnes
Reviews.Content: Which it was, hence the 5/5. Huge old building (former Stasi HQ I think) Cavernous lobby with a table tennis table, table football and kids roundabout in there. Small reception desk and impossible to tell who is a guest and who are staff (this is a good thing). Only forty rooms as this is really a private members club with rooms, but the style of the rooms reflects the whole building - spacious, stylish but not in your face chic. Great restaurant and lovely roof terrace with pool which was perfect for breakfast. If you like your hotel to be formal and corporate you need to go elsewhere - they won't let you in wearing a suit (I mean it!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Adst73
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin on Business and was booked into Soho House and i loved it. The rooms and the staff really are great, without going over the top and nothing at all was a problem. It is a little more expensive than other hotels in Berlin, but is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “11/10”
Reviews.Author: Stoofer189
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Staff and service first class. Attention to detail in the rooms worth the £ Were there to see Berlin for 1st time but quite tempting to stay in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of luxury in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Julia75
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. Very luxurious and couldn't have asked for better service. You need to be prepared to be surrounded by a very young crowd, but as long as you don't mind that, this place is fabulous. Nice gym, so much better than hotel gyms, great food that is reasonably priced. Watch out for the cowshed products though, which are much more expensive than you can buy online. Cycle hire is expensive at 20 euros for 24 hours, but Berlin is brilliant for cyclists so worth doing.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JWBklyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and thought there was a lot to like. Staff was welcoming, design and style were cutting edge, but very comfortable (bed, bathroom), and little quirks such as the light dimming system were overlooked in favor of the real phonograph and LP's provided in the room, along with the ton of soaps, gels, shampoos, etc. The lounge/restaurant was a great hanging out place and the food was certainly better than adequate. I loved that they kept the background music in the BACKGROUND! Workout room isn't extensive but has the basics. Did not try the Cowshed spa but hear it's deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool and trendy - Perfect place for a weekend in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MrB4688
Reviews.Content: 18 of us stayed here for a friend's 40th and had an amazing weekend. The staff couldn't have been more helpful with their recommendations and for putting up with us! The rooms were beautifully finished in the typical 'Soho House' style of retro/modern styling - We stayed in one of the extra large rooms which was 1500 sq ft and bigger than most apartments let alone other hotel suites I've stayed in! We hosted drinks in the room for our group which the staff helped organise and it was like having a private party in my own flat. Roof top pool and bar were great for lying about and seemed to be open almost all day and all night. All in all I'd highly recommend this place and will certainly be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBinNY
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor and service was exceptional. Room was very well designed - I booked a large room and it was indeed very large. Staff were very friendly and assisted me on my first trip to Berlin. The only negative I arrived for business at 9am and still didn't get my room until 4pm. which was a pain as I had meetings all afternoon and wanted to relax and shower before them. Otherwise well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “epic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: we visited the Soho House Berlin with no real idea what to expect. they upgraded our room for no reason and put us in a palace. everything in the hotel was first class. It's not in the center of town but why leave your room. Restaurant and bar upstairs were incredible. we LOVE this place. highly recommend this spot on your next trip

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travelling_addict_8
Reviews.Content: Last week I stayed for one night at Soho House Berlin on a work trip. The hotel is very hip and trendy but still manages to be comfortable and welcoming (perhaps not the hotel foyer!) Check in was swift, although they had my booking under the wrong name despite changing it three weeks prior. I stayed in a small room which surprisingly was a very good size, it would be a suite if you were staying in London or New York! There was a super comfy king size bed with lovely bed linen, plus a large flat screen tv, sounds system, big comfy chair and a sideboard with books and tea tray. They had lots of nice big fluffly towels and the shower was a lovely big rain shower and there were cowshed products for use whilst staying at the hotel (i think there were three different types of shampoo!) plus minitaures of every other bathroom product you could want - razor, comb, cleanser, cotton buds, toothbrush etc etc. Breakfast was nice, good quality products and an extensive menu of freshly cooked items plus a contential buffet if you wanted it (extra charge), we were in a big party so service of the food was a bit slow but drinks were served quickly. not cheap but woudl set you up nicely for a day of sightseeing. We had drinks in the bar downstairs and they had some delicious cocktails, not sure of the price as I wasnt paying but im sure they werent cheap. The barmen were fun once they loosened up a bit. Some of the staff are a bit stand offish and think they are uber cool but generally helpful. Didnt go to the pool or the spa as i didnt have time :( maybe next time! Would definitely stay here again. Re location to be honest really not sure where it is in relation to any of the sights as we took a taxi in the dark from the airport (abotu 30 minutes) and then to a restaurant then back to the hotel so apologies for not being helpful here but it was a work business trip not a social event. The room rates are very reasonable (i paid €190 for a thursday night stay and booked about two months in advance) and i think well worth it. Any questions let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, uber chic & cool”
Reviews.Author: dibbles77
Reviews.Content: This is a really cool hotel! While it's not in the absolute centre of the action, the few minutes extra that you need to walk are well worth it. The views from the bar across Berlin are spectacular, the food delicious, the rooms comfortable and homely, the outdoor heated swimming pool a 'must-do' and the staff are world-class. Well worth a stay. You wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Exciting Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jeleconiac
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay in one of the big rooms at Soho House and I was amazed by the look and the feel of the room. Everything was feel done and well thought. The atmosphere was lovely and you feel at home. This hotel is not for everybody as it is quite trendy and very hype at the moment in Berlin. If you have the money and love a fashion hotel this is the place to be right now in Berlin. But if you are with your family, want a hotel with not a lot of people this is not a good choice. The hotel is part of a club everywhere around the world and a lot of club members just go there for the gym and to socialize over drinks and dinner so it is always quite busy. But it is also the place for the young Berlin crowd and it has an amazing view on Berlin and it is well located.

Reviews.Title: “excellent rooms, large!! nice view”
Reviews.Author: Nicklas W
Reviews.Content: exellent views, breakfast, expensive if ala carte, large rooms, would stay again, and again, and longer, would like to live there.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Management at the hotel's club”
Reviews.Author: Bestofceline
Reviews.Content: Top floor club has terrible management style. even if you are hotel's staying guest, they dont treat you right at this club. very snob attitude. we were very unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: geir_bjorsvik
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at Soho House Berlin. We were immedietely taken away by the cool rooms at the hotel. Large rooms with av very big and comfortable bed. And the interior was really exciting. Service all round was excellent during our stay. Everybody was very positive and helpful. Hotel is on a busy road but it was completely quiet. The hotel is close to the Mitte district and many museums. And the neighbourhood offers some of the best shopping areas in Berlin. But be sure to spend at least one evening at the amazing top floor bar. The view is one of the best in Berlin, and it is a very young and vibrant atmosphere. And the pool at the rooftop is a nice place to chill out on a hot day. The hotel also offers a great spa. Will i return to this hotel - absolutely :-)

Reviews.Title: “Better than Dean Street and I love Dean Street!”
Reviews.Author: Phillicj
Reviews.Content: its all about having ones expectations met and in every single way Soho House Berlin did that and a good chunk more besides...Thank you to everyone there who made our too short break so fantastic. loved it! Roll on New York but it's got a lot to live up to!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly fantastic”
Reviews.Author: amitjalan7
Reviews.Content: Gritty Berlin has been given a dose of quietly eccentric English charm with the arrival of Soho House Berlin. The 40 bedrooms represent the hotel component of this members' club, part of the Soho House Group, which has restaurants, cinemas, bars and spas on both sides of the Atlantic. The Berlin outpost has many similarities with the others, particularly in the creative crowd it attracts, relaxing beside the fireplaces of the Club Floor, tucked away in a padded window alcove or basking on the large green-and-white striped sun-loungers beside the rooftop pool. Typical, too, are the industrial design elements in the public spaces (exposed brick, concrete pillars), offset by the prettiness of the bedrooms (lively floral prints). The 'Tiny' rooms under the eaves reflect an 'anything goes' Berlin mood with wooden bedsteads and metal side tables; the other (much larger) bedrooms have supersized, padded-velvet headboards, faux-fur throws and pillows aplenty. Hot-water bottles, home-baked shortbread and Roberts radios are among the English quirks found in this Art Deco former department store, once headquarters to the Communist Party. Breakfasts on the rooftop terrace with views of the Fernsehturm, Berlin's iconic TV tower, are a treat. In the basement there's a Cowshed spa, screening room, library and bar; there's also a gym on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay at this club/hotel.”
Reviews.Author: aligs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the late May Bank Holiday weekend for 4 nights - we had a wedding to attend and it was my b'day. Like other reviewers, we were impressed with the service all round - much friendlier and more helpful than when we stayed at Shoreditch House last year. Staff actually appeared to be enjoying their jobs too which was good to see. We certainly weren't treated any differently to the actual members of the place and were allowed to sign our friends in as members would do. Our room was classified in the "Tiny" category but it really wasn't. It was a bargain at 100 euros a night. There was enough room for a super-kingsize bed and other bits and pieces of furniture. The bathroom was big and included a fantastic rain shower - no need to take your toiletries bag as they provide lovely full-size Cowshed Spa products as well as toothpaste, mouthwash, razor, deodrant and various other miniatures. This is so handy if you want to travel with hand luggage only on Easyjet! Otherwise the room was very quiet with good thick curtains on the windows - great for me as I'm a light sleeper. There was a good flat-screen TV and DVD, plus iPod dock. Good quality bedding, tea, proper coffee and biscuits added to the feeling that I did not want to leave this room! The club floor on the 7th floor is really cosy and nicely done out. We easily whiled away our last afternoon here with a drink and the paper and, importantly, there was no pressure from staff to buy drinks or food. The rooftop bar and pool is very buzzy and was busy most of the time because it was hot. The bar staff seemed to be under a lot of pressure but were nonetheless as polite as the other staff. The food and drink is reasonably pricey I guess (probably not much more than you'd pay for a meal in London really) but we expected that and we were there for a celebration so it didn't bother us. We ate one breakfast there and a dinner plus various drinks at different times, everything I had was very tasty and all served using decent crockery, glassware and cutlery. The spa was excellent. My therapist was very good and patient with my ticklish feet, in addition to speaking great English! I didn't have any cash on me at the time stupidly so ran back to my room to get a tip for her. When I got back down to the spa, they asked me if I was sure I'd like to leave a tip as they didn't have a policy at all and then thanked me very much for it - I really appreciated that and it was another score for the staff. The location is good and it's very easy to get to from Alexanderplatz. Otherwise it's pretty easy to get to other places for sight-seeing, eating and drinking using public transport or walking. There were all sorts of people staying here so I'd recommend it to anyone from couples to business people. I think most people would feel comfortable here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: DM45ESS
Reviews.Content: Just had 4 nights at Soho House Berlin. Service all round was excellent, waiting staff were brilliant and so were the reception staff, all really friendly and helpful. Maria on the front desk was especially brilliant with advice and tips when I needed help. Our room was great, (room 40), really large with the biggest and most comfortable bed you can imagine. Shower room was great, had the option to turn it into a steam room. Hotel is on a busy road but it was completely quiet, my Husband is a light sleeper and the outside noise just does not penetrate the rooms. Close to the Mitte district and museums, all walkable. Food was good apart from the breakfast sausages, they were terrible but all other food and drinks were great. Really lively bar by the pool, full of people from all walks of life. The design of the hotel is brilliant - sparse in places but so cosy in others, really done well.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: martinmchugh50
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend, anniversary celebration and could not have had better value and comfort for a chill-out luxuriating type of place. Reception and service wonderfully laid back and personal. As others have said, the design and attention to detail has the wow factor. Such is the range of the room service products, it was difficult not to spend most of the day in the shower. The small rooms (misnomer) on the 5th floor are fantastically quiet and well sound proofed. After three days, I even managed to master the super cool dimmer switches on the lights. Important tip: don't bother to pack your wash bag, as you can be pretty sure most of your contents will look out of place against the massively and elegantly stocked Cowshed items.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning design. Amazing Rooms. Fab views from pool on the roof.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cool and trendy. I am a well travelled person but felt as if I needed to be a celeb/cooler than me. The rooms and pubic spaces are stunning. I was in room 6 (small) and room 7 (medium). They were amazingly well stocked. Beautiful linens. Small rooms are certainly spacious. The medium room was vast! Location not bad but I wasn't keen on immediate surroundings. However, easy walk to the main sights and the area up the hill had lovely delis and shops a bit like Notting Hill. One grumble was I did let them know in advanced I needed an early check in. Got there at 12 and room not ready until nearly 4pm. They did not offer complimentary beverages but did suggest I relax in the bar or spa. Food was not bad, though as a foodie I would say the pizza was better at I due Forni nearby. Nevertheless I would recommend this hotel. The swim in the rooftop pool on the last morning was spectacular. Just bring your black trendy clothes and designer glasses and you'll fit right in. Ps the Bircher muslei for breakfast is delicious and will keep you full for hours. Do try fat bike tours for a fun and informative day which is very safe and easy, and is a great way to get around.

Reviews.Title: “this is how a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: coo06
Reviews.Content: probaly one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in including the 5 stars, Hyatt Parks, Mandorins etc. Ambient-perfect/coolness-perfect/staff-perfect (although a little slow sometimes in the restaurant)/room-perfect-sleep/bed-above perfect/food-excellent. a briliant concept hotel with a wonderful heart, very well informed staff, we had a feeling of belonging from the beginning and enjoyed our stay throughout. the car-arrival could be better solved so that it is not neccessayr to unpack a car on a main road. we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the Best Hotel Bed in the World”
Reviews.Author: CFLDI
Reviews.Content: Amazing. I love the decor and attention to detail in this very cool Berlin Hotel. I rate the bed as the best I've ever had, and I've stayed in a lot of hotels! I accidentally left some duty free products in the room when I checked out, but the staff fedex-ed them to me in Australia. Now that's service!

Reviews.Title: “Best City hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ballner
Reviews.Content: Have been at Soho House Berlin during ITB. Great place! Excellent and helpful service, nice (very large) rooms (I booked a Medium Size Room and it was really huge). The restaurant / Lounge at the 7th floor is cosy and "trendy & cool", but the staff is still very friendly. Breakfast there is a relaxing start for your day in Berlin. Well equipped gym and great Spa. Don't forget to enjoy a drink on the rooftop bar. I can really recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking for a weekend-citybreak or on business in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very fun and beautiful place, ask for specific rooms to have a quiet experience”
Reviews.Author: Leenekin
Reviews.Content: I do really like the Soho House Group. Having stayed in quite a few in the UK , Berlin's version is stylish, in a great location and in general a very pleasant experience. Members can get rooms from 75 Euros (special promotion) upwards. The rooms are amazingly furnished, very stylish and Berlin retro chic. I love their cowshed range of products and I have asked on all of my business trips there (been 3 times) for specific rooms, having read here that certain areas and floors can get busy. My recommendation is room 32. It is on the 5th Floor right hidden in the corner. Probably their smaller rooms but it is super cute, still has a beautfil balcony, huge double bed and TV and coffee/ tea/minibar/ snacks the usual and the bathroom has walkin shower and the great cowshed products. A few minor points in this specific room are no hair dryer (or at least I couldnt find one) and no full length mirror. But in the other two rooms I have stayed in (on the third floor) they did have those. I can recommend it, thought it is for a certain demographic I would say. It is definitely a place to be seen and it is the media/fashion/music industry mostly meeting there. Great location and i find the value for money also reasonable. The inhouse free steam room, pool and movie theatre are a definite plus!

Reviews.Title: “Bauhaus Concrete Style but 5* Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Hammythehamster
Reviews.Content: Whether you're a member of Soho House or not, this house has so much to offer, in a city that has so much to offer. I stayed in a mid-sized room, but even the smallest are a good size, and a peek inside the largest room showed it to be positively gargantuan. Every night the top floor was buzzing, but this didn't mean that the hotel was noisy - the heavy concrete floors and lintels seem to soak up the sound, and I found my room to be very quiet indeed. Special mention has to go to the beds though - the comfiest I've ever experienced. Really liked the service too - thoroughly professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Escape”
Reviews.Author: aardwhite
Reviews.Content: In common with, I expect, the vast majority of users of this site I often promise myself that I will write a review when I get back from a holiday or break, and have never yet done so. This time however, my experience was so utterly at odds with the previous review that I feel honour bound to do so. I read this review the day before my wife and I were due to fly, and it did worry me to the extent that I planned to pack some earplugs. I forgot of course, but as it happens it didn’t matter because a) there was no extraneous noise in the room we were given and b) the hotel supplied them anyway amongst a plethora of gratis bathroom items. To be fair, the room we had was on the 5th floor so there was a clear floor between both the Bar on the 7th and the Politburo club on the 3rd which may have helped. This may be something that you might want to mention when booking if you think that noise may be an issue for you. I’m pretty sure the majority of rooms are on the 5th floor. I do not recognise at all the description of the desk staff at all. Yes, there were a lot of them but they were polite, professional, helpful and courteous. Each and every one of them. On each and every occasion. Without fail. One is left only to assume that some sort of attitudinal mirror was in effect. In fact it was not just the front-of-house staff, but the restaurant staff, the hard-working and stretched bar staff, and the spa staff. They were uniformly excellent. The room we had was beautiful. Sumptuously furnished with a fabulous bed and gorgeous detail all round. My wife adored the roll top bath. I spent a good deal of time in the spa area which was very nice indeed. It is essentially an enormous hammam which had a steam room and sauna as separate ante rooms. It is perfectly easy to lose hours there and the Cowshed products in the changing areas leave you feeling wonderful. My only criticism would be that it could have a slightly larger relaxation area. You can relax in the spacious hammam, but that never cools you down totally as it periodically becomes thick with steam. The showers within the hammam are very cold though. Perfect. I can’t recommend this hotel, or commend its staff highly enough. Berlin is a fascinating and vibrant city and this is a beautiful bolt hole to recharge you each day.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!!! NOT A HOTEL BUT A CLUB WITH ROOMS - DREADFUL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beaviebob
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Soho House Hotel in Berlin. What a disappointment!!!!. I have stayed at 4/5 Star Hotels throughout the world and this was the worst I have ever stayed in. The Rooms, Hotel and Club are Beautiful - Decor and Style cannot be faulted but all this is all spoiled by the experience of staying there. Firstly the Reception Staff are badly trained - rude and arrogant. You never see the same staff on the desk. They have little idea of how to deal with people. In our first room on the 6th Floor we were kept awake most of the night by what sounded like tables and chairs being moved about and footsteps from the Club Lounge above - Floor 7. It is open until 3 am and then staff start cleaning etc at 5.30 am ready for breakfast at 7 am. We asked to be moved the next day and were told to pack our belongings again and they would move us in the daytime. We returned to the hotel in the evening to find that we had not been moved and the desk staff had not idea about it - they were unhelpful and rude. After we a fuss they eventually promised we would be moved next day to a Large Room at no extra cost. We packed out stuff again!! and then (big joke by staff?) found ourselves in a large room which was the noisiest room in the hotel directly above the Dance Club and next to the smokers balcony. The Politburo continues till 4 am both on Saturdays and Thursdays - the bed may as well have been on the dance floor. Weird idea to have hotel and club together and advertise a a luxury hotel. This room still had the weired scrapping sounds all the time - like tables and chairs being moved - maybe displaced lift shaft/door sounds - but all the hotel had this sound. When we left and paid our bill the staff gave us our receipt and then just turned away not even saying thank you or goodbye - we spend over £1000 at this hotel!!! We were disgusted. A hotel run by children for children!!!!! Do not stay in this hotel if you are coming for a relaxing break.

Reviews.Title: “Packed full of peacocks, great rooms, ruined by miserable service”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyCow
Reviews.Content: Avoid third floor rooms on a weekend - music from the club below will keep you awake until 4. Fine if you're clubbing, painful if you're not. Earplugs cut the crap, but not the bass. Bar is a crèche on Sundays, as all the SH, but plenty of more interesting places around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “There is a difference between BIG and LARGE”
Reviews.Author: LadyPrimrose
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel, great staff, watch out for building work going on in the hotel (not major but can be noisy!!!) Went with a great couple and had a really great time, great bar on the top floor....and ping pong in reception is a definite must!!!!

Reviews.Title: “stay at soho berlin”
Reviews.Author: lkjhgZurich
Reviews.Content: this is THE place in berlin for the international party crowd. brand new, cool mix of old and rotten berlin style mixed with modern high end elements. reception doesn't look like it but offers table tennis. the rooms vary in size depending on the category but all are nice for a weekend stay. the private viewing room in the basement is super comfy and the top floor bar with the terrace pool a killer.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for their target group”
Reviews.Author: TrophyCollector
Reviews.Content: The Soho House is tailored for a very specific target group which I would describe as an urban, bohemian, overly casual upper-middle-class fashionista scene, maybe between 21 and 45, and mostly from the fashion, music, movie or advertising area. I would assume that the "club membership" makes sense for those people and works well with the local Berliner crowd who get access to the lounge area on the 7th floor, the rooftop pool and bar, the underground spa, cinema and library. All these are spectacular and a must-see. If you are not a member, simply become a hotel guest to check it out for a night. The price level is surprisingly low (starting at ca. € 100) for the size of the room and the quality of the amenities. The food in the 7th floor restaurant is not bad, but there is room for small improvement. What really needs to be worked on is the service concept. Not only the (older) guests, but also the staff themselve struggle with the first-name basis. In Germany that is not going to work. Luckily, almost all staff were naturally friendly and without any design-hotel-syndrome. Another downside was the crowd in the lounge and the pool area - on SUNDAY: a real Kindergarden with more kids than grown-ups as it seemed. The worst part of the hotel: no driveway whatsoever (actually no place to stop a car or park legally at all ... dangerous!), no porter, no lobby. This really reduces the 5star luxury feeling to a 4star hotel. It will not become my personal home-away-from-home, but I think the SOHO House is a valid new concept which fits well into Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “If only I could live here....”
Reviews.Author: CharlieBunny
Reviews.Content: If, like me, you don't work in media or have friends in "the right places", then staying at one of the Soho House establishments might be your only chance to see behind the "members only" doors. The only downside to doing this is that you'll realise what you're missing out on! When we stayed there, Soho House Berlin was the newest House. The interiors are incredible throughout: loads of colour and different fabrics and carefully chosen antiques. The staff are all ridiculously good looking and multi lingual but at the same time SO nice and accommodating. We stayed in the "small" room, which was HUGE by normal hotel standards. The bathroom is packed full of Cowshed products for guests to use. My boyfriend would have happily spent the entire weekend under the monsoon shower head (apparently "the biggest he'd ever seen!"). Standing under the shower all weekend wouldn't have been much different to stepping outside since it rained fairly constantly. But thankfully that gave us an excuse to hang out in the club rooms, eat in the restaurant (very good and reasonably priced) and watch DVDs from the hotel library. My only criticisms would be the lighting in the rooms (although I like "mood lighting" it makes reading a travel guide or applying make up near impossible) and the pricing of the breakfast (we ordered from a la carte and had one bowl of cereal with fruit and yoghurt from the buffet and were charged as if we had ordered a bowl of cereal, a bowl of fruit and a bowl of yoghurt). Other than those minor criticisms, we loved it and would love to go back (but in summer next time so we can use the pool).

Reviews.Title: “Great service and fabulous bar / lounge & room”
Reviews.Author: jools58
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very friendly and helpful with no pretensions or attitude which I had half expected. The Club floor , bar /lounge area were great , really comfortable and a perfect environment for relaxing and lazing around. Really liked the casual dress 'code' . Both breakfast and dinner were good quality and reasonably priced. We were upgraded to a Big room which is exactly what it was ! The decor / fittings were all top class. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: elm0
Reviews.Content: It was a struggle to leave the hotel each day with a fabulous room of which we were upgraded to, fanatstic cowshed complimentary products and table tennis and fussball in the foyer! Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very fancy hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: travel_jane08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Soho House with my boyfriend last week and had a fabulous time! The first impression is kind of weird since there is nothing outside that you could possibly realize that this is a hotel; there is no display or anything. The lobby (if you can name it like that) is just a large, almost empty hall with table tennis, some kind of carrousel, two chairs and the very fancy Front Desk. But the rest of the hotel is way more exciting! We were welcomed very very nice, check in was fast and friendly and one of the bell guys not only showed us our room but also the great bar/restaurant and the rooftop terrace with another bar and pool. The only negative comment: the guy really did not have any idea of anything… We were wondering if there is anything special going on at the Bar since it was Thursday night – he had no idea since he just came back from holidays... I asked a couple of more questions since I am also working in the hospitality industry but he had no clue about hotel details and even gave me a wrong answer regarding the origin of the building. But whatever, the room was fantastic: tiny but cute, a great bed, sweet little details all over the place, a wonderful bath room with plenty of amenities, Bose Ipod docking station and great TV. We did not try the restaurant even though the offers are good and not too pricy. We had drinks at night at the rooftop bar right next to the pool and with a great view over Berlin and enjoyed the unique scenery; the ambiance everywhere is simply great and not comparable to any other hotel. Special thanks to Marie who was one of the most charming and friendly Front Desk people I have ever met. She gave us great advice where to have dinner and I just thought she could also be my very best girlfriend. All other people were also extremely friendly. We had a great time and will be back whenever we visit Berlin again! Thank you Soho House!

Reviews.Title: “Just Loved It”
Reviews.Author: stub0612
Reviews.Content: Just the place to be in berlin, nice people, non pretentious, great value for money and just like berlin as a whole, wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and trendy!”
Reviews.Author: rhlsharma400
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this place. It was up there as one of the best two places we stayed in Europe. It was a little expensive but worth it. We recommend with a whole heart.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and flirty”
Reviews.Author: schroppster
Reviews.Content: Soho House is the newest edition to the Soho House franchise. Although the hotel wasn't fully completed when i last visited it has loads to offer. The bar on the eigth floor has a small pool to swim in or just chill at on the outside deck. there are deck chairs and tables to eat at. There's also a bar and a restaurant on the 7th floor offering various cocktails, wines and a full menu of pizza, metas and vegetarian dishes. The hotel has a gym, a spa and a 36 seat movie theatre with 3 screenings a week in a 20's red velvet armchair atmosphere. Young people travelling will enjoy the closeness to Mitte and Prenzlauer Berg, Alexanderplatz is 5 minutes walk where public transportation takes you all over Berlin. The rooms are individually designes and look like they are straight out of a "Mad Men" set. You'll have all amenities and won't worry too much about bringing soaps, lotions and tootpaste. You'll never feel at home that easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with lots of potential if you like private clubs!”
Reviews.Author: Joizee_HD
Reviews.Content: I stayed here shortly after they opened. Granted, it's still a large construction site but I know the area well and am often in Berlin (as well as in Berlin hotels). I decided to try this place out as I am considering a membership and I managed to get a great rate: €95/night. Anyway, this place is stylish. You have to like the boutique hotel concept. There's lots of exposed, raw material from the original building here mixed in with stylish, high-end furnishings The people working here are all hipsters. The part of town is a mix of tourists, hipsters, businesses and yuppies. It's all combined one of those things you either like or dislike. I personally really enjoyed the hotel and it's perfectly located for me as I do business right next door and have many business partners within a short distance. I found staff to be extremely helpful and nice. There were a lot of people here from the London location so I hope future, local staff remains just as good. I also had drinks and dinner on the 7th floor. Drinks were good, Food was really good. If you stay, definitely eat here as well. I also used the gym. Still brand spanking new (on the 1st floor) and well stocked. If workouts are your thing, definitely bring your gym clothes. I didn't use the pool on the roof but it's quite small. It's more of an outdoor patio to see and be seen on. It was kind of cold so we didn't do much outside. Finally, free wireless LAN throughout the hotel and in room, water, coffee and milk are free. They have great products in the bathroom as well from Cowshed but if you take them with you, you will be charged. Anyway, I really enjoyed my stay and will definitely be back. Not yet sure about becoming a member of the Soho House but I will use the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Soho House Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Torstrasse 1, 10119 Berlin, Germany
